input_text:
Job Title: SME Computer Systems Architect (Cloud Operations) 

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
SME Computer Systems Architect (Cloud Operations) – Army Office of Enterprise ManagementRemote 
IPTA’s Technology Solutions Team is passionate about providing our customers with technical solutions that satisfy their business needs. Through collaborative interactions with customers, team members, subject matter experts (SMEs), technical leaders, and partners we design practical solutions that solve real problems for major government and business organizations. As a member of our Technology Solutions group, you will work with a team of technologists focused on delivering innovative business solutions using emerging technologies through proven successful methods. 
Our Team:

We are looking for talented people who are enthusiastic about applying technology to deliver innovative outcomes with “fierce determination, fearless integrity, and passionate service.” Our belief is that our people are the key to success. By encouraging and enabling continued learning, our team members grow to achieve their personal career goals. We are looking for:

Smart people with a passion for technologyAbility to solve challenging business problemsSelf-directed professionalsHunger to continually learn and grow  
Responsibilities:

Lead the strategic planning and execution of Enterprise Scale Application Architecture and Migration initiatives into Commercial Cloud EnvironmentsDesign, develop, and document comprehensive Application Architecture logical and entity framework Designs, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and industry best practicesOffer technical expertise to facilitate application assessments, providing insights for decisions regarding application rehosting, re-platforming, refactor/replace, retire, or retain strategies to effectively meet mission requirementsProvide ongoing support and enhancements for applications post-migration to the cloud, ensuring optimal performance and continuous improvement in collaboration with cross-functional teams

Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related fieldMinimum of 5 years of progressive experience in Application Architecture, Design, Refactoring, microservices, and web servicesFamiliarity and experience with the 7 Rs in software development used in Agile methodologies Demonstrated experience in structured design and documentation of cloud architectures, including diagrams, description of components, and their interactions 3-5 years of hands-on experience in designing cloud solutions, preferably with AWSAbility to obtain US DoD Security Clearance
Desired Qualifications:

Active Secret Clearance or higher is desiredProficiency in AWS PaaS Services, including integration of Databases, VMs, and Low Code/No Code solutionsProficiency in containerization technologies such as Docker and KubernetesKnowledge of infrastructure as code (IaC) principles and tools such as Terraform or CloudFormationAdvanced knowledge in technical domains such as serverless architecture and Low Code/No Code Analytics ApplicationsExpertise in AWS/Azure DevSecOps Services, specifically in AWS and/or Azure Pipeline-based CI/CD software releases and code branch workflowsExperience with Visio or similar diagramming tools for technical documentation and visualizationCertifications such as AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect, or Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA) would be a plus 

IPT Associates, LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified employees and applicants for employment. The Company does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, status as a veteran or disabled veteran or any other characteristic protected by law. We base all employment decisions, including recruitment, selection, training, compensation, benefits, discipline, promotions, transfers, lay-offs, returns from lay-off, terminations, and social and recreational programs on the principles of equal employment opportunity. 
The compensation range for this role is up to 180k based on the function, education, experience and qualifications of the applicants. IPTA provides a variety of benefits including health and dental insurance, life and disability insurance, matching 401k, savings plan, company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO). 
Our employees have diverse backgrounds, skills, and ideas that collectively contribute to a rich working environment and greater opportunity for innovation. 

#dice#clearance

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
